qas.question: What percentage of Germans are Roman Catholic?
What percentage of Germans are Evangelical Protestants?
What religion is the North and East part of Germany?
Where is there a non-religious majority?

answers.text: Hamburg and the East German states

qas.question: What religion makes up 30.8% of Europe's population?
Where is 38.8% of the population atheists?
What German city is predominately Catholic?

context: According to the latest nationwide census, <b4_0>Roman Catholics<b4_0/> constituted <a0_0>30.8<a0_0/>% of the total population of <b5_0>Germany<b5_0/>, followed by the Evangelical Protestants at <a1_0>30.3<a1_0/>%. Other religions, atheists or not specified constituted 38.8% of the population at the time. Among "others" are Protestants not included in Evangelical Church of Germany, and other Christians such as the Restorationist New Apostolic Church. Protestantism was more common among the citizens of Germany. The North and East Germany is predominantly <a2_0>Protestant<a2_0/>, the South and West rather Catholic. Nowadays there is a non-religious majority in <a3_0><b6_0>Hamburg<b6_0/> and the East German states<a3_0/>.
